mention.text: the nominee '' What if Clarence Thomas gets on the court now
the Supreme Court as an institution
the most important case '' since Brown vs. Board of Education Judge Thomas

those who had qualms about Judge Thomas before Anita Hill 's accusations against him exploded in public worry that the hearings will push him in a different direction '' He now sees himself as the victim of some kind of left-wing conspiracy , '' says Estelle Rogers , a Washington attorney As a result , the victim of some kind of left-wing conspiracy argues , Judge Thomas will be more likely to rule against the interests of civil rights organizations and women 's groups that opposed him Others are concerned that the Supreme Court as an institution will be diminished for having Judge Thomas on the bench , even though Prof. Hill 's allegations of misconduct were not proven Conservative legal commentator Bruce Fein , who had been a Thomas supporter , says the Senate should have rejected the nominee because '' the Supreme Court
the victim of some kind of left-wing conspiracy
the victim of some kind of left-wing conspiracy
chairman of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
